intro: Prionitis scabrida, commonly known as rough prionitis, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, elliptical fruits. It is native to regions of eastern North America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Prionitis scabrida is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects.
